newsitem.title: USA: Man convicted of thefts from military base.
newsitem.headline: Man convicted of thefts from military base.

text.p: A man accused of stealing missile launchers, airport runway snowblower trucks and other vehicles from a military base was found guilty Tuesday of bribery, conspiracy and theft.
The jury verdict against Leo Platz, 37, of Hudson, Wisconsin, came after a five-day trial in U.S. District Court. Five other men charged in the same scheme will be tried later.
Federal prosecutors said Platz bribed a civilian employee at Fort McCoy, Wisconsin, to help him convert and steal the equipment.
During the trial it was alleged that Platz got and re-sold TOW missile launchers, cargo carriers, jeeps, snowblowers and other pieces of heavy equipment.
Prosecutors said he sold a snowblower truck to a Colorado municipality for $53,900 and a missile launcher, a Sheridan tank and a Howitze for $90,000 to an individual in Portola Valley, California.
Another missile launcher fetched $43,000 from an individual in Oklahoma, prosecutors said.
